Medicines Given At The Hospital
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Items: Medicines Given At The Hospital
By Lisa Shock on Sunday, December 1, 2002 - 09:59 am:

Just thought I'd make a list of what the Hospital offers:

ItemCostDescription
Caffeironkeeps the monster awake
Capsainnimprove circulation
Deworm XL1000Rids the body of all worms
FebtoseA very valuable source of vital energy
HepanoylImprove circulation.
Hyper SA vitamin pill
Indamecenea plaster for inflammation.
Iprorofenfor headaches


Thanks to: Psyphon, Vega

By John Hawley on Sunday, December 1, 2002 - 10:14 am:

Which would seem to imply that there are lesser versions of the Deworm medicine, i.e. Deworm and Deworm L.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, December 1, 2002 - 10:42 am:

Or Deworm M, S, XS....each eliminating some but not all worms...

By GameAW on Saturday, December 10, 2005 - 03:57 pm:

How dare they eliminate worms! I say get them out of his/her body & raise them! lol (Couldn't help it)

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, December 26, 2006 - 08:53 am:

Worms appears to be a random event.

By Lil_Literalist on Sunday, April 1, 2007 - 11:17 am:

Actually, they trigger when you have been doing something too long (usually). For instance, If you feed your monster meat or fish too long, it will get worms (time it happens is random, but if you feed your monster anything but meat and fish, it won't get worms).

Also, if you just train in one drill for a long time, your monster will need Hepanoyl and Indamecene. Maybe if you constantly keep your monster tired, or you feed it nothing, you will need one of the other medicines.

By Blackish_ on Tuesday, April 24, 2007 - 01:34 pm:

It's gotta be random. I fed my Mint one helping of meat for the month's food and she immediately got Worms. Before that it was a mix of vitamins and bannanas.

By Lil_Literalist on Tuesday, April 24, 2007 - 03:40 pm:

Thanks for confirming this.
